description: Article 1.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): The applicant must clearly state which licensing category they are applying for: Category 1 (Payment Service Provider - PSP) for payment processing/e-money issuance, Category 2 (Marketplace Lending - P2P/Crowdfunding) for lending platforms, or Category 3 (Digital Wealth Management) for robo-advisory services.
Article 1.2.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): Payment Service Providers (Category 1) must maintain minimum regulatory capital of QAR 5,000,000 at all times.
Article 1.2.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): Marketplace Lending platforms (Category 2) must maintain minimum regulatory capital of QAR 7,500,000 at all times.

requirement: Minimum Capital Requirements - Digital Wealth Management (Category 3)
description: Article 1.2.3 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): Digital Wealth Management entities (Category 3) must maintain minimum regulatory capital of QAR 4,000,000 at all times.
Article 2.1.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): CVs, organizational charts, and police clearance certificates must be submitted for all Board Members, the CEO, and the designated Compliance Officer.
Article 2.1.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-001): The final, signed Articles of Association (AoA) must be submitted before the Conditional License is issued. The entity must be registered in the State of Qatar.
Article 1.1.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): All regulated Fintech entities must implement enhanced Customer Due Diligence (CDD) procedures for any user transacting more than QAR 10,000 per calendar month.

Article 1.1.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): For high-risk customers or transactions exceeding QAR 50,000, the entity must obtain and maintain records documenting the verified source of funds and source of wealth.

Article 1.1.3 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): A minimum of two forms of government-issued identification must be verified using digital and non-editable means. Proof of Residency must be obtained for all international users.

Article 1.1.4 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): The entity must submit a written, Board-approved Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Financing of Terrorism (CFT) Policy, clearly outlining transaction monitoring rules.

Article 1.2.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): The entity must deploy an automated transaction monitoring system capable of identifying and flagging suspicious activity based on patterns, velocity, and deviation from typical customer behavior.
Article 1.2.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): All Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) must be filed with the relevant Qatari authorities within 48 hours of detection.

Article 2.1.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): All customer personal identifiable information (PII) and transactional data related to Qatari citizens and residents must be stored on servers physically located within the State of Qatar.
Article 2.1.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): Explicit, informed consent must be obtained from the customer for the sharing of any data with third-party service providers (including cloud providers).
Article 2.2.1 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): The entity must appoint a designated, independent Compliance Officer whose CV and credentials must be submitted to the QCB for approval prior to licensing.
Article 2.2.2 (QCB-FINTECH-2025-003): An annual external audit of all technology systems and compliance policies is mandatory.
